This Rural Development grant investment will be used to provide technical assistance and training to rural areas to improve passenger transportation services or facilities. Funds will primarily be focused on projects in Missouri (Dade County); Michigan (Houghton); New Mexico (Grant County); and Southern Georgia (Atkinson, Bacon, Ben Hill, Clinch, Irwin, Turner, Ware, Berrien, Brantley, Brooks, Charlton, Coffee, Cook, Echols, Lanier, Pierce, and Tift Counties).

This Rural Development grant investment will be used to provide technical assistance and training to rural areas to improve passenger transportation services or facilities operated by Federally Recognized Native American Tribes. Funds will primarily be focused on White Earth Reservation in Minnesota.

This Rural Development investment will be used to help the Cooperative Development Foundation preserve and enhance their ability to deliver technical assistance through research, outreach, and education. These grant funds will be used to expand home care cooperatives in rural areas through cooperative development with the objective of improving economic conditions and strengthening communities.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY GRANTS TO ASSIST MINORITY PRODUCERS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance that focuses on the development and execution of a national strategy for rural home care cooperative development. Cooperative Development Foundations mission is to promote community, economic, and social development through cooperative enterprise, its headquarters is located in Washington, DC.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop the capacity of ten rural non-profit community based housing organizations across the country. These recipients will undertake projects related to housing, community facilities, or community and economic development in rural areas. Rebuilding Together provides technical assistance, training, and financial assistance to strengthen the recipients organizational capacity as they work in their local communities. The ten non-profits that will benefit as beneficiaries are: Rebuilding Together Henry County (IL), Rebuilding Together Muscatine (IA), Rebuilding Together Kent County (MD), Rebuilding Together Platte Valley East (NE), Rebuilding Together Dutchess County (NY), Rebuilding Together Saratoga County (NY), Rebuilding Together Kiamichi County (OK), Rebuilding Together Thurston County (WA), Rebuilding Together Queen Annes County (MD), and Rebuilding Together Sheboygan County (WI). The national non-metropolitan median household income is $51,914. This funding will augment the funding from last fiscal year.

borrower_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE FOR PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS
funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used toprovide direct strategic planning support to an identified set of prospective charter school Community Facilities (CF) borrowers. The project combines charter school strategic planning expertise with capacity building resources and support specifically geared toward CF readiness.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used toaddress the capacity needs of 12 nonprofit and tribal organizations serving high need, underserved, and communities of persistent poverty across rural America. This grant program will encompass technical assistance and training aimed at increasing recipient capacity to improve housing, community, and economic development opportunities and bring capital and resources to underserved areas.

funding_code: CF RURAL HOSPITAL PILOT PROGRAM GRANTS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to establish a cooperative agreement that will assist rural residents, businesses and other organizations and professionals in the rural health sector by providing affordable and effective technical assistance that can help rural hospitals better manage their financial and business strategies to improve their financial and operational performance, prevent further hospital closings and strengthen the delivery of healthcare for rural communities.

This Rural Development investment will be used by the Housing Assistance Council to assist the ultimate recipients in capital development by incorporating direct technical assistance to non-profits, particularly in the areas of identifying, utilizing, and applying for financial resources and identifying and engaging community stakeholders and partners. The purpose of the grant is to identify and transform space in the community to a facility that benefits all, such as a community center, library, childcare center or clinic. The Housing Assistance Council works across the nation in rural areas that may be susceptible to isolation, lack of access to jobs, capital, healthcare, and infrastructure, and a high percentage of opioid abuse. They type of technical and training assistance they provide includes Community Facilities Capacity Enrichment, Organizational Assessments, Organizational and Financial Management, Project Feasibility, Community Outreach, Development Budget, and Project Financing. This funding is augmented by a grant in 2020 for $150,000 that is currently being carried out.

borrower_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE FOR PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Charter School Facility Center at the National Alliance for Public Charter Schools to provide direct technical assistance and training to rural charter schools engaged in the community development process. This includes those who are prospective borrowers to USDA funding programs such as Community Facilities. As charter schools often identify facilities needs as their largest challenge, and the USDA Community Facilities loans have the most favorable financing terms, prospective charter schools need greater awareness of the opportunities offered by USDA. The schools that have used Community Facility financing the most are located in North Carolina, Utah, Hawaii and Delaware, so the National Alliance for Public Charter Schools aims to extend this reach to the rural areas in other states. This funding will allow the National Alliance for Public Charter Schools to address gaps in awareness and capacity and move towards a successful future by assisting with pre-applications, applications, and financial feasibility studies.

This Rural Development investment will be used to conduct a national program to provide technical assistance and training to reduce pollution of water resources and improve planning and management of solid waste sites in rural communities.

This Rural Development investment will be used to provide in-depth on-site technical assistance for at least 720 projects, serving at least 710 small systems that will be selected in consultation with state and area USDA Rural Development (RD) offices. Of those 720 projects, RCAP will identify 24 projects with systems that have previously attended RCAP Workshop in a Box training and provide follow-up technical assistance based on the action plans created within those workshops. RCAP will also provide Geographic Information System services through 54 projects as an additional technical assistance activity. RCAP will help systems inventory assets and develop system maps, which are the cornerstone of effective asset management and emergency response. RCAP will also present 132 interactive training sessions to at least 1,100 attendees including system operators, managers, and board members, focusing on topics including sustainable utility management/Workshop in a Box, board roles and responsibilities, rate setting, asset management, and emerging contaminants including PFAS. In addition, RCAP is proposing to develop one innovative, blended self-paced e-learning modules on a key managerial and financial topic to help systems move toward sustainability. RCAP is also proposing to deliver two national webinars on similarly important managerial and financial topics which may include regional utility partnerships.
Detailed Project Description Not Available

This Rural Development investment will be used to provide training and hands-on technical assistance to a minimum of 40 projects in four states benefiting up to 70 Colonias areas. A minimum of five projects will be "regional" in nature, creating systems or arrangements that serve multiple communities and allow them to achieve economies of scale. Projects will provide technical assistance in organizational development and technical, managerial, and financial capacity; pre-development activities for infrastructure project development; funding applications to USDA RD and other sources for planning, design and construction of water and/or wastewater facilities for first-time services and upgrading existing systems; and regulatory compliance and/or regionalization.

This Rural Development investment will be used to provide on-site technical assistance and training to at least 20 systems serving large numbers of tribal members (tribal systems) in at least 10 states. They will be selected in consultation with state RD offices and other federal agencies, as appropriate. RCAP will also convene 28 trainings for tribal systems or gatherings of Native American Water Masters Associations (NAWMA). NAWMAs goal is to bring tribal operators together regularly to share their common water/wastewater challenges, receive related training, promote operator advancement, and build capacity to create stronger utilities.
This Rural Development investment will be used to support technical assistance for rural transportation systems in Southeast Alaska; LaBelle, Florida; and Coos County, New Hampshire.
This Rural Development investment will be used to support technical assistance for rural transportation systems on Table Bluff Reservation in Loleta, California.

This Rural Development investment will be used by the Cooperative Development Foundation located in Washington, DC. Funds will be utilized to further the development and execution of a national strategy for rural home health care cooperative development and support CDFs long-standing commitment to providing accessible and healthy food in rural communities through its work with rural food cooperatives. In addition, funds will be utilized for a new project, which will investigate the potential for cooperative housing as a solution to the affordable housing shortage in rural communities. The Cooperative Development Foundation serves at the national level, working with local partners to create cooperative solutions.

naics_description: OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS (EXCEPT BUSINESS, PROFESSIONAL, LABOR, AND POLITICAL ORGANIZATIONS)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to further the development and execution of a national strategy for rural home care cooperative development. This includes support to further the work of the Native American Agriculture Fund (NAAF) to explore the potential for cooperatives to build a more just and effective food system for Indian Country. Cooperative Development Foundation serves at the national level, working with local partners to create cooperative solutions.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to address the capacity needs of 17 recipient organizations serving persistent poverty communities, high need regions, and USDAs key priorities of: Counties in the top 10 percent of those impacted by COVID-19, communities with a score of .75+ on the CDC Social Vulnerability Index, and coal, oil and gas, and power plant communities whose economic well-being ranks in the most distressed tier according to the Distressed Communities Index. Housing Assistance Councils program will encompass technical assistance and training to increase recipient capacity to create housing, community, and economic development opportunities and bring resources to underserved areas.Housing Assistance Councils program will encompass technical assistance and training to increase recipient capacity to create housing, community, and economic development opportunities and bring resources to underserved areas.

borrower_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE FOR PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS
funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the disadvantaged community of Asbury Park, New Jersey to recover economically from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. This project will help create a safe and secure education facility to reduce the spread of illnesses and reduce the rate of school closures and the resulting disruptions to working families, essential workers, and economic activity.

funding_code: RURAL HOSPITAL PILOT PROGRAM TAT GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist residents of rural areas, businesses, and other organizations and professionals in the rural health sector by providing affordable and effective technical assistance. This project will help rural hospitals better manage their financial and business strategies to improve their key performance and operational performance, prevent further hospital closings and strengthen the delivery of health care for rural communities.

borrower_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE FOR PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide direct technical assistance and training to rural charter schools engaged in the community development process. This includes those who are prospective borrowers to USDA funding programs such as Community Facilities. As charter schools often identify facility needs as their largest challenge, and the USDA Community Facilities loans have the most favorable financing terms, prospective charter schools need greater awareness of the opportunities offered by USDA. The schools that have used Community Facility financing the most are located in North Carolina, Utah, Hawaii and Delaware, so the National Alliance for Public Charter Schools aims to extend this reach to the rural areas in other states. This funding will allow the National Alliance for Public Charter Schools to address gaps in awareness and capacity and move towards a successful future by assisting with pre-applications, applications, and financial feasibility studies. The ultimate recipients for this year are as follows: Academy of Seminole, Charlton Heston Academy, Clarksdale Collegiate, Copper Island Academy, Kanuikapono, Leflore Legacy, Robert Frost Public Charter School, Roots and Wings Community School, Southwest Open, and Yuba River Charter School.
Detailed Project Description Not Available

This Rural Development initiative will be used to provide on-site technical assistance to at least 39 projects benefitting more than 12 Priority 1 and 2 Colonia areas. At least eight projects will be regional. RCAP will develop a pipeline of Colonia water and wastewater projects, secure engineering, legal and other professional services, assist with organizational (and regional) creation, and with preparation of loan and grant applications.
Detailed Project Description Not Available
Detailed Project Description Not Available

This Rural Development investment will be used to help NADO partner with the Small Urban, Rural and Tribal Center on Mobility (SURTCOM) and The Northern Tier Regional Planning & Development (NTRPDC). The partnership will provide additional capacity to assist rural communities in improving their passenger transportation and rural development initiatives. The project will consist of overall project management and technical assistance to four regions or communities located in Escambia County, Alabama; Bradford County, Pennsylvania; and Humboldt County, California.

This Rural Development investment will be used to benefit communities around the nation by providing critical information and technical assistance to develop projects that are expected to support regional economies by addressing businesses and residents transportation challenges and concerns. The project team supports reliable and affordable transportation options may help businesses to fill vacant positions and improve the viability of those businesses, particularly in the communities within and surrounding the Yankton Sioux Reservation in South Dakota, where employers report transportation as one barrier to recruiting employees and reducing turnover.

naics_description: OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS (EXCEPT BUSINESS, PROFESSIONAL, LABOR, AND POLITICAL ORGANIZATIONS)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to provide technical assistance to further the development and execution of a national strategy for rural home care cooperative development. Cooperative Development Foundation is a 79-year-old nonprofit headquartered in Washington, D.C. It specifically targets the home care/elder care population because there is a dire need in rural areas for elder care that is affordable. Additionally, many seniors prefer to stay in their own homes for comfort and cost-effectiveness rather than move to a group home. The grant will be used for research, outreach, and conferences, and to build and expand the capacity of home care owners to successfully manage their enterprises.

naics_description: OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS (EXCEPT BUSINESS, PROFESSIONAL, LABOR, AND POLITICAL ORGANIZATIONS)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to women-owned and particularly Native American-owned home care cooperatives in rural areas. The goal of the technical assistance is to help home care co-ops remain profitable, expand operations, and serve more residents in rural areas in need, despite significant industry challenges. In addition, Cooperative Development Foundation is proposing to continue a partnership initiated in 2020 with Native American agriculturalists to enhance the practice of Native-owed food production, marketing and distribution. This project will serve rural areas in Wisconsin, Washington, Minnesota, and California.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide customized, direct technical assistance to six of Rural Initiative members in the NeighborWorks network. Their program goal is to provide assistance that will benefit most for their specific community and conditions.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to address the capacity needs of 35 recipient organizations serving persistent poverty communities, high needs regions, and USDAs key priorities. Housing Assistance Councils will encompass technical assistance and training to increase recipient capacity to create housing, community, and economic development opportunities and bring resources to underserved areas. Activities will include tailored one-on-on technical assistance.

funding_code: RURAL HOSPITAL PILOT PROGRAM TAT GRANT
project_announced_description: This cooperative agreement will enable Rural Development to work with the National Rural health Association to support access to healthcare for rural communities, businesses, and other organizations, by providing affordable and effective technical assistance that can help rural hospitals better manage their financial and business strategies to improve their financial and operational performance, prevent further hospital closings and strengthen the delivery of healthcare for rural communities.

This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance and training to reduce water-resources pollution and improve solid-waste site planning and management in rural communities. The Rural Community Assistance Partnership Inc. (RCAP) will conduct a national program in collaboration with its six regional partners: Communities Unlimited (CU); Great Lakes Community Action Partnership (GLCAP); Midwest Assistance Program (MAP); Rural Community Assistance Corporation (RCAC); RCAP Solutions (RSOL); and Southeast Rural Community Assistance Project (SERCAP).

This Rural Development investment will provide training and hands-on technical assistance to a minimum of 38projects benefiting at least 69 Colonias areas. A minimum of 7 projects will be regional in nature, creating systems or arrangements that serve multiple communities and allow them to achieve economies of scale. Projects will provide TA in the following categories: (1) organizational development/technical, managerial, and financial (TMF) capacity building (2) pre-development activities for infrastructure project development; (3) funding applications; and (4) Regulatory Compliance and/or Regionalization.

This Rural Development investment will be used to provide in-depth on-site TA through at least 558 projects, provide Geographic Information System services through 48 projects, help systems to inventory assets and develop system maps, which will also be paramount for lead service line inventories and replacement tracking. RCAP will also present 96 interactive training sessions to at least 960 attendees, and develop two new training modules for administrative professionals/clerks.

This Rural Development initiative will be used to provide on-site technical assistance and training via 21 technical assistance projects to at least 21 systems serving large numbers of Tribal members/Tribal systems in at least 10 states, selected in consultation with state USDA offices and other federal agencies, as appropriate. RCAP will also convene 22 trainings for Tribal systems or gatherings of Native American Water Masters Associations (NAWMA). NAWMA goal is to bring Tribal operators together regularly to share their common water/wastewater challenges, receive related training, promote operator advancement, and build capacity to create stronger utilities.
